policy_title: Sexual Harassment Elimination and Prevention Policy

rules_and_scope.status: Serious punishable offense and a grave breach of discipline (Social Misconduct).
extended_coverage: Acts where the victim or perpetrator is related to EWU.
Acts committed using cyber space (e-mail, SMS, posters, etc.).
examples_of_prohibited_conduct: Teasing through remarks or indecent gestures (including stalking, abusive remarks, humiliation).
Exhibiting sexually offensive content (photos, digital images, cartoons).
Displaying sexually offensive behavior in or beyond the classroom.
Spreading scandals or attempting character assassination for sexual defamation.

committee_structure.gender_representation: Majority of members are women, head is a woman (if available).
committee_structure.external_members: Includes representatives from UGC (University Grants Commission) and an organization working on gender issues.

procedure: Identities of complainants are kept confidential (to the extent possible).
Investigation report with recommendation is submitted to the EWU Syndicate.
complaint_and_investigation_steps.timeline: Report submission within 30 working days (extendable up to 60 days).

student_penalties_range: Cancellation of examination and/or an assignment.
Expulsion for one or more semesters.
Expulsion from the University (the most severe penalty).
punishments_and_sanctions.faculty_staff_sanctions: Disciplinary or remedial action, which may lead to termination of employment.
punishments_and_sanctions.record_impact: Any imposed penalty/punishment on a student will be reflected in their Academic Transcripts/documents.
punishments_and_sanctions.false_complaint_consequence: If a complaint is proven to have been filed intentionally false, appropriate action will be recommended against the complainant.
